Reviews.Title: “dont get room 132 if there is a function on”
Reviews.Author: sheilamarshall
Reviews.Content: Our trip at the Winchester was brilliant despite the fact that the pool and sauna facilities were closed for repair. The food was great, accomodation good, staff helpful and friendly. However, there was a function on and it was so loud you couldn't hear the t.v. properly in the room. We were room 132 and so if you want an early night don't go for this room as it is directly above the function room. It did finish at 11.30 though and it was for a charity but I still thought it might help to mention it

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but disappointing visit”
Reviews.Author: Morrie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Winchester Hotel over the weekend of 17th & 18th December 2011. The hotel is modern and well presented and the reception staff were very pleasant and helpful. It is also well located, with the town centre only a short walk away. Secure parking is available within the hotel car park, albeit it is on a first come, first served basis. There is further unsecure parking in front of the hotel. Unfortunately, the hotel was very busy on the first evening of our stay, with many Christmas parties and this was to our detriment. We were allocated Room 1, which is located adjacent to the hotel entrance and we were disturbed until the early hours of the Sunday morning by smokers standing right outside the entrance (and our window) and revellers leaving. We booked a Heritage Break, which includes a 3 course dinner on Saturday night. Whilst the food looked the part, the taste really let it down. Would not dine in the restaurant again. We were also disappointed that breakfast the next morning was served on cold plates and the food was not hot. Having said this, our second night was much better and we slept well. Breakfast the next morning was only let down by the service, which was not great. We would stay at the Winchester Hotel again, but would request a room at the rear of the hotel and would definately eat out.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in fairly central location”
Reviews.Author: supersailor
Reviews.Content: After a 5 1/2 hour car journey arrived at the hotel. Open reception and bar area greeted us. The reception staff were not very welcoming and helpful. We were not told where the lifts were to get to our room or asked if we wanted a daily newspaper the following morning. Our second floor room was clean, adequate sized room with tv and tea/coffee facilities, safe and ironing board! The bathroom had only one free shower/shampoo, no sewing kit, or any other requirements needed, ie, body lotion, hair net etc. Bathroom was clean but there was no fan! Signs were displayed to ask residents to leave the door open! Room facilities information was not there, ie tv instructions, laundry facilities etc. Noisy residents disturbed us nightly as our room was situated in the middle of a corridor. The swimming pool was very small, one child's small pool and a very small adult's pool. There was a gym attached to the hotel but did not use it. We ate out at Loch Fyne in Winchester. The hotel's own restaurant was not appetising. Breakfast on the other hand was excellent. The staff could not be more helpful. The choice adequate and suitable for all tastes. We will look at other hotels in the area when we visit again and as a last resort may stay at this hotel. A visit to Winchester Cathedral is a must.

Reviews.Title: “No Concern for the Customer Here”
Reviews.Author: nkdOhio
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Winchester on May 11, 2009 after making a reservation several months in advance and requesting the ground floor due to problems with stair climbing. Friends were with us so we had two rooms. One room was on the first floor (2nd in US) and the other in the basement (#2), The room on the first floor was nice although small but the basement room was so small you couldn't get the closet door open all the way. But the main problem was the manager on duty. When we ask for a better room she said none were available and then proceeded to check later arrivals into better rooms. We ask for a restaurant recommendation but when we didn't let her make a reservation for us she became rude. After that almost anything I asked about I was told that she couldn't help me. Our room was very cold so we asked for heat but she told us if they gave us heat then the upstairs would get too hot. After much complaining the next day she finally turned on the heat for about an hour then shut it off again because people upstairs complained. The first night we had to take cold showers because the night clerk couldn't tell us how to operate the water temperature control. We had booked three nights but left after two because we couldn't take the cold cramped room or the lack of good service any more. They advertised free Wi Fi it didn't work. I have waited 5 months to write this review to make sure I hadn't changed my feelings about the Winchester. To be fair my daughter stayed at the Winchester a few weeks later without any negative incidents.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: jarnold10
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews prior to our trip we were a little worried. We need not have, even though the room was quite small, it was clean and well serviced. The staff were very friendly and the breakfast was cooked freshly for us. The location was perfect, 5 mins walk to Victoria where we picked up the tube system. We were also able to walk to lots of restaurants and attractions. For the reasonable cost we thought we had our monies worth (for Central London).

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the photo's”
Reviews.Author: nwaautopilot
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here. The main good point is the location. Very close to restaurants, a market, the Victoria station, and walking distance to Buckingham Palace. The bad point was the room. We had a room with two single beds. VERY very small, even for European standards. The room also had dirty carpet and worn furniture. On arrival the first day we found dried "snot" "bogeys" or "boogers" on the walls. The staff did clean that for us. Some of the staff was helpful others not so. The breakfast staff was courteous but the food was not very good. As other reviewers have said there are no outlets in the bathroom, and only one of three in the main room worked. Had to unplug the TV to use that one. Would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel of good points and bad points”
Reviews.Author: scottjturner
Reviews.Content: The Staff - The staff were very friendly and made us feel welcome, the two girls who appear to clean and serve breakfast were especially helpful and attentative. The Room - The bedroom was quite small (to be expected in location?) and filled with furniture which looked like it came from a house clearance. It was very clea though. The bathroom had a good shower and was modern but very cramped. Breakfast - We had to que for breakfast as the hotel did not have enough tables, food was not too bad. Waitresses were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our 10 day stay, clean, comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: agi56
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 days in July 2009 - myself and 2 teenagers. Had room #4 - family room with 1 double bed and 2 single beds. Little bit crowded but we didn't go to London to spend lots of time in the hotel. Had enough space to move around and store all the luggage. Very clean and daily maid service kept it that way. No A/C but hadn't expected it. Left windows open a bit all day, and with the fan running we were perfectly comfortable. Excellent location - few blocks from Victoria Station. I enjoyed breakfast every morning but my teens preferred to sleep in and we picked up some breakfast at Sainsbury market in Victoria Station on our way to the Tube. There was a computer with internet available for guests and wireless in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here”
Reviews.Author: sohrmurphy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was recommended in a guide book and boy, were we sorry. Don't be deceived by the pictures on the internet of the hotel unless they are from travellers. They hotel is further away from Victoria Station than their website makes it sound. The main problem we had with the hotel is that the interior is very old and dated. The carpet looks horrible and there is no lift. We were given a tiny room for a "triple" and because it also had two worn and old looking chairs in there, we hardly had room to walk between the beds. The extra mattress that they put on the floor partially blocked the doorway to the bathroom. There was no a/c and we had to ask for a fan which (thank goodness) they had. We had rooms on the front and it was kind of noisy. We did have an interesting view out our window...of a "lady of the evening" who either had an apartment on the upper floor of the hotel across the street or was using the hotel as a base. She undressed in front of the open window, came out on her balcony in her bra and panties and strutted her stuff up and down the street every evening. Not exactly what you want your 3 teenagers to see. The prices were very, very high for the quality of the rooms. It is rated a 3 star hotel, but there is no way...I'd say a low 2 and that's being generous. We would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value - great location and room!”
Reviews.Author: Readybluedragon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights. We had requested a room at the back so stayed in Room 19. It wasn't overly large but itt had two chairs, tea and coffee facilities, a built in wardrobe and a large bathroom. The only criticism was that they don't have hand towels but give you face washers to dry your hands. Fantastic location close to a main tube station (Victoria) and close to Lizzie's house (Buckingham Palace). Free internet too. The bed was very comfortable and the shower was large. It could do with air conditioning in the warmer weather as our first night it was warm so slept with the windows open (we were on first floor). Couldn't ask for a more comfortable hotel in a great location close to trains, buses, lots of restaurants and pubs and shops. Breakfasts were good (full service) although fresh fruit would have been nice rather than canned fruit salad. Keep up the good work. Staff very helpful and pleasant. Close to the hop on hop off bus starting bus stop too.

Reviews.Title: “Better insight now that I have traveled aboard”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyWanders
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Winchester a total of 7 nights. The first stay was in the family room number one. (I read all the comments prior to booking.) We needed a family room which is sometimes hard to find. Room 1 has a double with two singles. The room was large but hard to move in due to all the beds. The bathroom is good size. The room we stayed in the last two nights was small. This was room 5 on the second floor. A double with one single bed. For two nights we were fine. The bathroom was small. The hot water continued to be a problem while we stayed. We did find out that there is a safety button on the handle and was sometimes the cause of no hot water. Other times it was the number of guests taking showers at one time. We took showers at different times to have hot water. We did eat the full English Breakfast many mornings. You can make changes to the breakfast menu of only the foods offered. You can order eggs and not the full breakfast. The internet worked through our first visit and did not our second visit but was being repaired. The TV in room 1 needed a new cable but did not get one. Room 65the TV works well. It is in a great location just a few blocks from Victoria Station which made taking the buses around the city easier. Trains also connect to Gatewick Airport. There are grocerys and places to eat in walking distance. The staff is friendly and someone is always at the front desk. Ice and drinks are also available.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it should be....”
Reviews.Author: rleNewEngland
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to our visit to the Winchester and its location on the quiet side of Victoria Station. We (four of us in two rooms) were at the Winchester for two nights. I wasn't expecting a grand hotel but it still fell short. I have now learned the property is under new management.....new from my original reservation through my travel agent. At one time we were staying three nights but canceled within the correct time frame. We arrived to learn we had been charged for our missed night. This issue is still being working out with the third party Unirez who no longer represent the hotel....ie new management. Strike one. The rooms were fine, small but I knew that going in. The full English breakfask as not full.....missing the mushrooms and beans. Strike two. Overall the staff were adequate but not overly friendly or helpful. Strike three.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel in good, central location”
Reviews.Author: travelfl12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Winchester for 2 nights following a transatlantic cruise that ended in Harwich. The location of the hotel is excellent with just a 3-4 block walk to Victoria Station for the tube or buses, etc. There are no elevators and no "common" room where you could go to sit and visit. We were 3 couples traveling together. Our room had a nice bath, but the other 2 couples complained about their small baths. The rooms in general are quite small, but adequate when you spend no time there. The only thing in our room that I felt wasn't clean was the tired, soiled carpet. The breakfast certainly wasn't like the one pictured on their web site. The dining room was adequate w/white table linens, but didn't like the bacon, sausages, or the scrambled eggs. Corn flakes and orange juice were great. Fortunately for Americans, the exchange verses the pound has moved in our favor recently, so that made the hotel a fairly good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: FishWY41
Reviews.Content: I was eager to find a comfortable getaway in London after reading the other reviews. Unfortunately, I found a very small, dated room with a dirty carpet at the top of 71 steep stairs. Although I requested a room on a lower floor when I made the reservation (due to my mother's heart condition), we were told that all rooms had been booked and we were placed on the very top level. The morning ritual for my mom was interesting (family vacation). There were no outlets in the bathroom, so she had to unplug the TV to use the hair dryer. I guess it was a good thing because she used the TV screen as a mirror to do her hair. The bell-boy helped us with a bag in the morning. We missed breakfast because they don't start serving until 7AM. It is very close to the Victoria station which made getting on the Gatwick Express a breeze - something we were eager to do after our unpleasant experience at the Winchester.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajassal
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on 16 Feb 2009, I would never stay in this hotel. Had no hot water on first day and when complained was told to leave the water running for 10 minutes as it takes a while for the hot water to work as we were on 4th floor. After 20 minutes of running the water we still had no hot water so gave up. Next morning woke up to have a shower but still no hot water and was told by reception they had called maintence to get it fixed by 9am. We went to have breakfast and came back to our room to have a shower and still no hot water so decided to check out at 10am. When arrived at reception, two other persons that were checking out were also complaining of no hot water and they were on the 2nd floor, so obviously the receptionist was lying at the reason whey we had no hot water(4th floor water takes longer to get warm), asked for the manager who was conveniently away out of the country and the reception was unhelpful and could not do anything or give us a discount. Another 2 vistors that were staying at the hotel also while were checking out complained of no hot water. This is worst hotel I have ever stayed and would not recommend anyone to stay here!! The staff are very unhelpful and no lifts as we unfortunately got the 4th floor room!! Room was tiny and not very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms with basic services in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: nesten
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Winchester Hotel for 4 nights and had a very good experience. This is a very basic bed & breakfast set in an old house close to Victoria station and it offers decent rooms, basic services, and an excellent breakfast. The location is superb as it is in a relatively quiet street and about 4 blocks from a subway station (Victoria). From there you can be anywhere in London within minutes. With respect to the rooms, they have about 4 per floor and they are not very big. Please note that there is no elevator in the hotel, so if you are on the upper floors it's quite a trip to take the luggage upstairs. The bed is comfortable but the rooms are very dated and show a lot of wear. We did not care too much about this, since we were just looking for a place to rest for the night. The bathrooms is very small too but the shower was excellent (good pressure and hot water). The breakfast in the morning is excellent (full British breakfast) but the hours are very tight. They only serve it from 7am to 9am so be ready to wake up early. So overall, this is decent hotel to stay if you are looking for a budget stay in London (no frills) in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for money”
Reviews.Author: Coppergate
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Winchester Hotel when visiting a friend in the UK. The hotel is very centrally located and of good value. Of course there are not the luxuries of a larger hotel ie: lifts, large rooms etc, but it was well worth the price paid. The breakfasts were delicious and generous. The staff was more than helpful and I was offered help with luggage. The person who greeted me told me all about the sites and offers available for tourists. There is only one drawback for me. The walls are thin and unfortunately one night I had noisy neighbors in the next room. However, I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yardville
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Winchester during the height of the summer season in 2008. Very convenient to Victoria station trains and tube, and also to city buses. Also, it was one of the few hotels in London near 100 Euros per night, as they are all expensive and most are not worth the money. We were greeted by the owner who is a wonderful person and very, very helpful. I had booked our room on the top floor so as to have the least amount of noise. Since there is no lift, the walk up 5 flights was pretty difficult (make sure you're in good shape), but the hotel employee took our bags for us. The room was very small, but it was clean and had its own bathroom. The area is very nice and there is a pub on the corner with pretty good food. The entire staff were so helpful, I would recommend this hotel for a good base to explore London. If you want luxury, forget it. But if you want a clean room with a hearty breakfast for a good price, then the Winchester is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CanadaApril
Reviews.Content: Some background on us... Late twenty-somethings, no kids, looking to explore Europe in comfort ;o) After searching for months to find a decent affordable hotel in London, I stumbled across the Winchester. I had a good feeling from the reviews and the photos that were posted so we booked for 4 days at the beginning of October. It is a tiny little hotel but we expected that. A lot of European places are. My only criteria was wireless internet and it's own bathroom. I am just not into sharing a toilet or shower with others. We checked in around midnight and were given keys to our room. Very tiny. Barely enough room for the bed and 2 chairs but it was exactly what we needed. The bathroom was small as well but well lit and big enough for our needs (and i'm one with lots of hair appliances). We tried to hook up to the free wireless internet but realized we needed a password. No worries, we went to the 24 hour desk clerk and he provided us with the password so we could update our travel blog every day from our laptop. We found breakfast wonderful and it was never really full in the breakfast room so we never felt crowded. We actually only ate there the twice (even though it was included) as we found eating the bacon and eggs and toast to be quite heavy to start our day of touring so after that, we grabbed croissants from the tube stations. It doesn't have an elevator/lift but it was no issue for us as we were on the first floor. It may have been rough trying to lug our heavy suitcases up 4 flights of stairs. And there were lots and they were steep! All in all, we really enjoyed the hotel and the location. It was just a few blocks from Victoria Station so we were central to everything we needed. The only thing was that when we arrived at midnight, we were starving and nothing was open. No restaraunts, pubs, etc. It's more in a residential neighbourhood so there wasn't even any fast food places either to grap a quick snack.

Reviews.Title: “average British Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hivahoaBologna
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a nicely decorated room, that was also more spacious than others - of the same category - I have stayed at in London. The bathroom was new, nice and clean, but very small. The staff were helpful and kind enough, but we saw no trace of the owner, who was advertised on the website as the person in charge of the breakfast... Breakfast: it was advertised as the flagship of the venue, but.... I imagine it must be delightful for the Britons or others to have fat sausages, bacon, eggs and stuff early in the morning, along with a strong, horrible smell of fried food in the breakfast room, that sticks to your hair & clothes, but.... I think we Italians are more likely to give it a miss!! Also: the breakfast room has very strong lights, that hurt your eyes when you've just woken up: this shows no respect or consideration whatsoever for the guest's comfort. After the first day, the prospect of that smell, that horrible unhealthy food and those unbearable lights led us to have breakfast at a café nearby. Location: EXCELLENT, very central, just a few steps from Victoria Station & Tube, ideal base to explore London.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tp1rrj
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Winchester. We had a double room that was on the small side and was on the 4th floor with no lift. It was clean and there is a desk clerk available 24 hours with free internet. They also offer a full breakfast. The location is good if one needs to utilize the Victoria Coach or Victoria Train/Tube station.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: analex
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a couple of B&Bs in Belgravia and this is one of the better ones I've stayed in. There are cheaper places to stay but it was worth it for me to pay a little bit more for a better room. The neighborhood is safe and conveniently located near Victoria Station. Breakfast is included and the room was tidy. There isn't a lift so request a room on the ground floor. Overall, I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms, Decent Location, NO LIFT OR BAGGAGE HELP”
Reviews.Author: LBetus
Reviews.Content: This property was decent and clean, but I would encourage a traveler to mind the following before booking a room here: 1. There is no elevator/lift and the property is four (4) floors tall, with eight flights of steps in a very narrow stairwell. There was nobody to help with our bags upon arrival, so after traveling for 12 hours straight, we had to lug everything up there alone. 2. Showers have good water pressure, but only about 3 min of hot water. 3. Rooms are very small and only have one or two power outlets, making getting ready or usage of electronics difficult. 4. Wireless internet is free and works well. 5. Breakfast is good, but eggs taste a bit like chemicals (chemical eggs).

Reviews.Title: “Why Stay Anywhere Else?”
Reviews.Author: whamiFL
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just spent six nights at the Winchester Hotel and were very pleased. This is one of the cleanest hotel rooms I have stayed in, especially the bathroom. Very convenient to Victoria Station. We could walk there in three minutes and catch a train or the tube to almost anywhere. If you're flying into Gatwick, the Southern Rail train goes to Victoria for 10.90 pounds. There is a laundry less than two blocks away. We had a laptop with us. The wireless connection was erratic. At some times there were no issues at all. Later you would not be able to get any connection. If, like us, you are just wanting to check e-mail and upload some photos you can just try later. There was a safe in the closet that was big enough to hold my 15" laptop. While we did not have problems with the stairs, some people might. The breakfast room is one level below ground. Our room was up one floor in the back, facing another street. On occasion there was some street noise but it was very infrequent and never bothered us. The room was bigger than I expected, but by US standards it is very small. In such a great city, we didn't spend much time in our room anyway! As a guest, the only control you have over the temperature of your room is by opening or closing a window. It wasn't a big issue for us, but could be a concern if you want the temperature just right. We were there in October and had no need of air conditioning. I would imagine that the hotel could get a little uncomfortable in the hottest weeks of the summer. Pros: great water pressure, comfortable bed, safe big enough to fit a laptop, cheap price for the location, breakfast. Cons: temperature control, wireless network connection. The negatives were very minor considering all the positives and I have no doubt that I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would We Book It Again ?”
Reviews.Author: Dhplano
Reviews.Content: Our stay ( Wife & I ) was from Sept 5th for three nights. PROS : Within walking distance ( 10 minutes ) from Victoria Station Tube and train from Gatwick Airport. Rate includes breakfast and VAT and is Cheap compared to other London accommodations. Close to major attractions like Buckingham Palace and walkable to Harrods, Hyde Park, Winchester Cathedral, Parliament, London Eye etc. Restaurants and shops nearby. Room and bathroom were kept clean daily. Full English Breakfast was filling. In-room coffee maker / tea pot. Someone was always at Reception Desk to answer questions. Stored luggage when we arrived too early for room occupancy and carried it upstairs for us.Shower water pressure was refreshing. Free computer use. ( See CONS ) CONS : Rooms on lower floors and facing over Belgrave Road are noisy from night street and sidewalk traffic. Our first room was not conducive to sleep ( window stuck open a few inches ) so we had to request a change to one facing the back which was quiet. Walls are thin and entry doors of other adjacent rooms must be slammed to shut and make loud noises. No air-conditioning. Room Safe on closet floor very difficult to utilize. Computer " broke " after first day and was not fixed by the time we left. Sink is small and cramped and faucet water pressure is low. Would we Book It Again ? NO It was not bad, but there are lots of other choices and Trip Advisor Reviews can be consulted.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay - good value - great location”
Reviews.Author: SterlingTie
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from London where we stayed at the Winchester for 2 nights. We had 2 double rooms and found them generous-sized, clean and well-appointed. The rate was good and the hotel's proximity to the Victoria station made it a great location for touring central London. The breakfast is good - eggs, bacon, juice and coffee. The only disappointments were the long climb to the top - no elevator - not uncommon and the lack of information forthcoming form the staff. They were welcoming and friendly but not very well informed. All in all, a nice place to stay and a good bargain.

Reviews.Title: “grows on you”
Reviews.Author: cnkSeattle
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for my husband and myself and our two young adult children, because it was affordable. I wish we could have stayed in Kensington or Knightsbridge. On checking in, we were disappointed. My husband said we should think of it as a motel. Once we got settled in and started sight-seeing, we thought of Winchester Hotel as home. It is close to Victoria Station which has rail, underground, and buses, and in walking distance of Buckingham Palace. We easily visited many major sights by taxi and the underground. Abigail, who works the evening shift, gave us a superb recommendation for Indian food in the neighborhood. We went there twice out of three nights. It's called Paradise. Winchester Hotel serves a hearty English breakfast with eggs fried or scrambled to order, tomatoes, bacon and sausage, toast and croisant, and dry cereals.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: MsShaalot
Reviews.Content: Husband and I found this Hotel a good value for London. Location near Victoria Station helpful to get around. Safe residential area. Room was clean and towels refreshed daily. Room #20, ground floor, was a bit stuffy; fan in room helped, as did propping open the door to the hallway. Safe provided in the room. Proprietor pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: MagicStar
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for two nights with a couple of friends. We had a triple room ( double and single) which was small but with everything we needed. Beds comfortable, quiet room on the first floor (No 5), bathroom immaculate and newly refurbished or so it looked like. Towels changed daily. TV, hairdryer and kettle etc.. in the room too. Breakfast very good ( fruit juice/cereals/toast, muffins and crossiants/english breakfast) and kitchen also immaculate. Staff friendly and helpful. Location is excellent, 5 mins from Victoria station and within walking distance of Harrods and Kings Road. Good price of £120 per room, per night, especially for London and then you are left with more money to go shopping!!! or to a show!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DallasBear
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on our first trip to London. Great location, with a 5 minute walk from the Victoria tube station. No frills, but clean. The quad-room was a good size for a family. Wireless internet access was free and reliable (on the first floor). No elevator. No air conditioning. We requested a fan but were told there was only 3 fans for the hotel and they were all being used. Friendly staff. Breakfast and service was good, but scrambled eggs and bacon were a little wierd if you are from U.S.

Reviews.Title: “Got to be something better!”
Reviews.Author: Socalesq
Reviews.Content: First of all, on the plus side -- the hotel is located just a short 5 minute walk to Victoria Station, where you can easily get on the Hop on-Hop Off Bus Tour and the Tube. We felt safe walking back from the station late at night after a show. The breakfast was adequate and it was nice to not have to worry about finding a spot to eat before heading off to explore London. The rooms were clean. If that's all you expect from your accomodation in London, then this place will probably work for you. However, I expected a bit more and was disappointed. I had contacted the front desk by email when I made the booking in January to request 2 rooms, 1 king and 1 double, for our family of 4, next to or across the hall from each other. (We were travelling with our 2 children, so I wanted the kids' room to be near ours.) I was assured that they could and would accomodate my request. We arrived before check-in (about 9:30 AM) and were told that our rooms would be on different floors and said that they had never received any email with my request. (I wish I'd brought a copy of the emails between us!) The attitude of the woman working the front desk was one of total disinterest. The kids' tv didn't work and the hotel staff said they would fix it and never did. Our room was cold and when we called the front desk to see if the heat could be turned on nothing happened. My daughter asked the woman staffing the front desk if they could mail a postcard for her and was laughed at and told no. She asked where she could buy a stamp and they said they didn't know. Don't give these people your business, they don't deserve it. In all of London, there has got to be a better place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: ngarrido
Reviews.Content: It´s a great hotel for that amount of money. Service are excellent, specially breakfast people. The only recommendation, be aware not to get room N° 20! We got that room and have to change it because is near reception, very noisy and specially small compared with other rooms. Although that event, hotel is great!

Reviews.Title: “Cute old building”
Reviews.Author: jennifercaple
Reviews.Content: Basic room for London...no lift, adequate bathroom. Nice front desk staff although they seemed fake and forced. Very clean room and bathroom...nice little balcony garden that over looked the street--perhaps a bit overpriced @ $200 US dollars per night. Was convenient to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “value, comfort, great location”
Reviews.Author: sarony
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Winchester for one night whilst in London seeing a show, it is described as being 10 mins walk from Victoria station it's actually 5 which is even better. Check-in was prompt, hassle free and friendly as was check-out. breakfast the following morning was also as good as described full cooked, toast, croissant, buckets of tea and coffee. And as promised we were able to leave our bag's their in safe a place whilst we spent the next day in London. We walked to her maj's with ease in 10 mins from the hotel then a further 10 after tea with the corgi's brought us to Trafalgar square then 10 more took us to the London eye hence great location as the hotel describes. If your not up to the walk don't worry 5 mins back to Victoria station and the buses run believe it or not every 15mins all over London, bus fare £2.00 a ride. The room, was small but you could swing a cat if you wished, bed comfortable with extra pillows in the wardrobe which were found in a protective covers, two comfy chair's, tv, kettle selection of tea & coffee, clean towels, and the shower was excellent even provided shower gel, O and the heating work's. nice touch i thought, in reception which is 24hr, they have a chiller with pop & water £1, which in summer months when you wake needing a drink as i have is a god send. all staff encountered friendly, polite, informed & helpful. would definitely stay here again and have already recommended to friends and the "boss" must be good, all in all good value with comfort in a great central location.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: petalrose_8
Reviews.Content: After a long day travelling, it was nice to see a smiling face at reception, check-in easy, was directed to our room on the first floor overlooking the back of the hotel, it was small but we know this is the same in most hotels in London. The room was spotless it had a kettle, loads of coathangers, extra pillows, hairdryer and a couple of chairs, the temperature of the water and pressure were consistant at any time of day. The breakfast is really good, tea/coffee, juice, cereals,eggs and bacon, toast, jams, croissants and even mini muffins some mornings, served 7-9 so you can get a full day of sightseeing in, all this just round the corner from the station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pollyanna123
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Winchester Hotel. There were three adults in our party. Our room (#5) was very small, but typical for London and certainly adequate, as we spent most of our time touring London. The bathroom was tiny, but again adequate for our needs, and very clean. We had one double and one twin bed, both comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. The full English breakfast was awesome consisting of eggs cooked to order, toast, croissants, butter and jam, juice and tea. Delicious! Cold breakfast was also available. The location can't be beat - just 5 minutes' stroll from Victoria Station, which you access by taking the Piccadilly line from Heathrow Airiport. Reasonably priced compared to other places I checked. Of course, the US dollar:English Pounds exchange rate killed us all around. Would highly recommend the Winchester Hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: carrache
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant place, excellent staff, great location. I felt very comfortable here and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at the Winchester”
Reviews.Author: eregis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Winchester for 8 nights in October (20-28). The staff was very friendly and helpful and rooms clean and comfortable. We arrived before our room was ready. They let us leave our bags and when we came back they had taken them up to our room on the top floor. This was a small room with two single beds, but very comfortable. After three nights, they moved us to a larger double room one floor below that. Again, they moved our luggage for us. Hot English breakfast every morning or just cereal and toast if you prefered. The staff were very helpful when one of the day trip tours we had booked didn't work out and rebooked another tour for us. This was a very easy location near Victoria Station Tube and Buses. Nice little shopping area around the corner with cafes and shops and a local launderette where we washed our clothes mid-week. I would recommend this hotel. A very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place”
Reviews.Author: rjs035
Reviews.Content: Winchester Hotel is a nice little bed and breakfast type hotel. Breakfast was included and quite good. We got there early in the morning and they let us wash up in their courtesy bathroom and leave our luggage that they brought up to our third floor room. There is no elevator so if your room is up there, be prepared to do some stairs. The room was very small but had everything we needed. The bathroom also tiny. The toilet had a bit of trouble flushing, we told the staff and they said they'd look at it but I'm not sure if they ever did. The hotel is very close to Victoria Station so easy for the Tube or to the airports and more. The room was expensive 89 pounds a night - but everything is in London, especially with the exchange rate. The staff were quite friendly but sometimes comunication was not always the best. We would stay here again and enjoyed our time in London.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: uscwest
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our recent trip to London. We found the hotel and staff to be extremely accomodating. The hotel was coveniently located near Victoria Station and within easy walking distance of Buckingham Palace. When we had questions about places to eat or taking a bus somewhere the hotel staff was extremely knowledgable. Although the room seemed small it was very comfortable and well appointed. We unexpectedly had to return to London later in our trip and wish that we had chosen the Winchester once again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice B&B”
Reviews.Author: pattie917
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and had great luck. The room was small but had everything we needed. This place has location, nice employees, good breakfast and was a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite neighborhood stay in a city we love”
Reviews.Author: coni2728
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a two-week trip to England and Ireland. We began and ended our trip in London and for both of those short stays we booked the Winchester. It is actually our second stay in the hotel - we had been there four years earlier. The Winchester is in a terrific location for us - off the beaten path a little in Belgravia but very, very convenient for walking to Victoria Station and going anywhere within the city you may wish. We enjoy the neighborhood pubs and restaurants, the coffee and sandwich shops. You can certainly spend a lot more money for a room in London, but the Winchester has all that we need. Good price. Understated, yet clean and well-maintained. Helpful staff. Good and plentiful breakfast. Attention to special requests (We had a quiet room on the backside of the hotel!). We'll almost certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: member21
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very basic -- met our needs, but didn't "wow" us. We initially were given an unappealing room -- uncomfortable beds, needed fresh paint, poorly decorated. I complained and they graciously agreed to give us a different room for the next two nights (although we had to stay in the unappealing room for the first night). That said, the staff was very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was average. Our new room was much better than the first night, but still nothing special. Good location though. Close to Victoria Station, a central hub of the London underground. Nice neighborhood and area (Belgravia) of London.

Reviews.Title: “I'd come back!”
Reviews.Author: PintsofAle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 6 nights and it's fine. I'd have no issues with booking here again. The staff is very helpful and it's a great location. There was a mixed crowd of young kids/students and 40somethings. It did get a bit loud when the younger students came in between midnight and 2am. We stayed in room 3 which is ground level and faces away from the street (I would not stay if my room faced the street, unless I was at the top floor) Most of what people say is true - it is a bit threadbare, yes you can find stains on the blankets and lampshades if you look, the bed wasn't the most comfortable, but we slept fine..... I booked enough in advance that I could have booked a Luna Simone, but decided that the location was better (closer to grocery store and multiple pubs) and when you are hauling suitcases to/from Victoria the distance really counts.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Richard320
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of this hotel. It is on hotel row, there must be at leat 8 hotels immediately adjacent. It is about 5 minutes from Victoria Station on foot, and the coach terminal (bus station) is across the street from the railroad station. The Original Bus Tour of London has a pickup point right there at Victoria as well. There is a sort of mall above the station that includes a souvenir shop, a Boots drug store, and a small grocery store that is open until 11 pm. There's also every kind of fast food in the mall. The hotel staff was fine. There is internet access (says 10 minutes at a time, but not enforced if no one else is waiting) which is handy for online checkin for the return flight. The room was very small, but that is typical in England. No complaints about the cleanliness. There were a couple things that needing fixing, and when I told them to the girl at checkout, she opened a log and immediately wrote them down, which is a good sign. I might mention that unlike other reviewers, I have no complaint about water pressure. The breakfast is good and filling, keeps you going for hours of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: bobyvr06
Reviews.Content: Overall we thought this hotel was poor. The room was ok a bit worn and threadbare, the heating couldnt be controlled so we had to blow open the windows to try to cool the place down. The TV when turned on briefly had a nasty loud squeel (not that we were there to watch TV). The bed linens were excessively perfumed which bothered my during the night and added to the stuffiness. The staff were nice and identified a water heating problem which meant that there might be a problem showering, well they werent joking, there was no hot water or water pressure. This Hotel was recommended by Rick Steves book, anyway we busted out of there and went over to another nearby Hotel that was newly renovated ie everything functioned, was very clean and cost less money. I then had a proper full pressure shower!

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rafair065
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my wife and 8 year old son and really enjoyed my stay. For 90stg for a triple room per night it was worth it. Check-in was swift, hotel and room were always clean, English breakfast was good and the shower in the room was excellent. To add to this the staff was very friendly and really made us feel at home. The hotel is also well located with a 5 minute walk to Victoria Station. The only advise I give is that if you have elderly people with you ask for a room downstairs because there is no lift and the steps to reach the top floors are quite hard. I was on the third floor and the last thing you need is stairs after touring London. Having said this I would definitely recommend this hotel and will surely choose it for my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very clean”
Reviews.Author: natto
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the winchester in Dec. 06 with my husband and our two kids (20 & 18). I did some research and found that for the price it was a great deal for a quad en-suite room. We have stayed in the victoria station area before and found that it is very easy to get around London if you are in this area. The room we had was very clean, of course by US standards it was a little crowded, but if we want US hotels, we stay in the US. The bathroom was very roomy, I was expecting something smaller. The shower was a small stall type, however the water pressure was amazing, wish I could get that at home. I had read the reviews here and opted to shower at night to avoid hot water problems. My kids showered in the morning and we only had one morning when someone got a cool shower. Breakfast was good and service was very quick and friendly. The staff we found to be very friendly and helpful. They always greeted us with a smile and helped out with any questions we had. We were in a downstairs room, and it was always well heated, we in fact kept the windows open because it got a litte warm at times, I think the pipes for the boiler ran under the room. But with the window open the tempurature was fine. If you are looking for a well located, easy to get to, clean hotel, then I would recommend the Winchester.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place!”
Reviews.Author: brgreen
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay here after reading the Rick Steves' recommendation. The hotel is in a great location with a very helpful staff. We were on the third floor and there is no elevator so this is definitely not the hotel for people who can't walk a few flights of stairs. The included breakfast was filling and decent, just not gourmet.

Reviews.Title: “Victoria's Secret”
Reviews.Author: fairdos
Reviews.Content: IN the face of widespread enthusiasm on the part of other members not much needs to be added. In the intimate theatre of accommodation it is always pleasing when a production works as well as it does here, I needed to catch a very early Gatwick Express and cast around in the Victoria area for an overnight stop. The Winchester is 5 minutes from the station rear entrance which gives on to the Gatwick Shuttle platforms. My rear top-floor ( fourth) room was small but nicely furnished - a small attic window gave an agreeable view of the roofs of Pimlico backed by the London Eye. Bathroom also small and needed attention behind the taps in the shower. But all cleverly squeezed into the space available. I had to leave before the " Full English " came on stream but there was no difficulty in obtaining from reception coffee, croissant & yoghourt and having it served to me there before I left. I could not trace on the internet sites I consulted any single rooms so was obliged to take a twin - perhaps the hotel could think about a rate for double room with single occupancy ? Otherwise, chapeau...!

Reviews.Title: “Would Return to Winchester”
Reviews.Author: swedest-gal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Winchester Hotel for 3 nights and found the hotel comfortable and cozy. The room rate is reasonable considering the fantastic location. Victoria station is not even a 5 minute walk. The room was tidy and all the basics were there. The breakfast included in the rate was great. Both the service and the food was excellent. Parking over the weekend was not a problem and was free but during the weekdays the car had to be moved to an NCP lot. All in all the stay was trouble free and we would definitely stay at the Winchester again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Winchester”
Reviews.Author: catslavebabe
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's a little shabby, and being right by Victoria Station, it's not as quiet as a monastery, but very comfy and very homey. The breakfast was good and the dining room cozy-- we got to talk to alot of the other guests. The shower had amazing water pressure and was as hot as we wanted, even on the top floor. The staff is incredibly accommodating and helpful. One issue for travellers that are not as spry as they once were: there is no elevator and stairs are required to get to the breakfast room and to nearly all of the rooms. Steep, narrow stairs. This is an old building, with all that goes with it. If you want new and shiny, stay in the States!

Reviews.Title: “Chintzy and quaint!”
Reviews.Author: fionapage
Reviews.Content: We booked a hotel on a last minute website, only to arrive and find the worst hotel i've ever seen, so we walked along belgrave roadlooking for alternative accommodation. We found it at the winchester, run by a lovely, very friendly chap named jimmy who was very accommodating and found us a room. Apparently the curtains here are made by the same lady who makes the curtains for buckingham palace! The room was chintzy and a bit old fashioned, but had a lovely comfy bed, was clean and well kept, and very 'english' (my first weekend away with a partner ever - it was just what we wanted!) The breakfast was great and was cooked by jimmy himself, who also went round offering baskets of muffins. It was a fairly good value london hotel. we had no problems, staff were lovely and we left feeling like we'd had a great weekend. Would recommend for one or two nights for a cosy break!

HotelInfo.Name: Winchester Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 17 Belgrave Road, London SW1 1RB, England
